title: Unclear what "chunked" vs "single-shot" modes do
description: CLI offers two modes but doesn't explain what each does, when to use them, or how they differ. Users must guess or experiment to understand functionality. Blocked by ISSUE-009 (single-shot not implemented). See original issue file for full details.

title: Automated Quality Validation
description:
Check generated doc quality against criteria before user review.

**Origin:** Problem A Version 2 #61 (2025-11-18-problem-a-template-system)

**Value:**
- Catches issues before user review
- Automated quality gates
- Consistent quality standards

**Reconsider When:**
- 5+ successful regenerations show common quality patterns
- User checks same things repeatedly
- Quality issues are predictable

**Complexity:** Medium (define criteria, implement checks, validation rules)
**Effort:** 2-3 days

**Implementation Notes:**
- Define quality criteria
- Automated validation checks
- Scoring and reporting
- Actionable feedback

title: Git Hook Integration
description:
Automatically trigger regeneration on git events (pre-commit, post-merge, etc.).

**Origin:** Test Case Phase 2 #38 (2025-11-19-test-case-basic-regen)

**Value:**
- Docs stay in sync with code changes without manual intervention
- Automated regeneration as part of git workflow
- Prevent forgetting to regenerate

**Reconsider When:**
- Manual regeneration becomes routine part of git workflow
- Users report "I forgot to regenerate before committing" 3+ times
- Git integration patterns emerge from actual usage

**Complexity:** Medium (git hooks, performance, user control)
**Effort:** 2-3 days

**Implementation Notes:**
- Pre-commit hook for doc validation
- Post-merge hook for automatic regeneration
- User control over when hooks run
- Performance considerations (fast hooks)

title: Doc Health Dashboard
description:
Overview showing status of all docs (stale, healthy, needs review).

**What it does:**
- Visibility into doc ecosystem
- Prioritization of updates
- Track improvement over time
- Identify problematic docs

**Why Valuable:**
Portfolio view for managing multiple documents.

**Why Deferred:**
- Need multiple docs in system first
- Status criteria must be established
- Single-doc focus for MVP

**Reconsider When:**
- Managing 10+ docs with the tool
- Unclear which docs need attention
- Manual tracking becomes tedious
- Portfolio view is requested

**Effort:** 1 week
**Complexity:** Medium
**Origin:** Problem A convergence (2025-11-18-problem-a-template-system)

title: Relevancy Scoring for Sources
description:
Score each source file 1-10 for relevance, include only high-scoring sources.

**Origin:** Test Case Optimization #52 (2025-11-19-test-case-basic-regen)

**Value:**
- Reduces context size
- Improves focus
- Lowers cost
- Better quality through relevant context

**Reconsider When:**
- Templates regularly include irrelevant sources (>30% unused)
- Context size becomes problem (hitting LLM limits)
- Cost optimization becomes priority

**Complexity:** Medium (scoring heuristics, thresholds, validation)
**Effort:** 2-3 days

**Implementation Notes:**
- Relevancy scoring algorithm
- Threshold configuration
- Source selection based on scores
- Feedback loop for improvement

title: Selective Section Regeneration
description:
Regenerate specific sections while keeping others frozen.

**What it does:**
- Preserve manually edited sections
- Surgical updates for efficiency
- Fine-grained control
- Reduce regeneration time

**Why Valuable:**
Enables targeted updates without affecting stable sections.

**Why Deferred:**
- Full regeneration tests core assumption first
- Adds complexity to workflow
- Preview/accept provides control for now

**Reconsider When:**
- Users regularly reject full regeneration due to one section
- Manual edits need preservation across regenerations
- Regeneration time becomes problematic (>2 minutes)
- Section-level control requested explicitly

**Effort:** 3-4 days
**Complexity:** Medium
**Origin:** Problem A convergence (2025-11-18-problem-a-template-system)

title: Makefile regen-doc Missing OUTPUT Parameter
description: Makefile regen-doc target doesn't expose the --output CLI option that the underlying command supports. Usage message also doesn't mention OUTPUT parameter, creating discoverability issues and incomplete feature parity between Makefile wrapper and CLI. See original issue file for full details.

title: Post-Order Validation and Updates
description:
After generating all sections, validate consistency and update earlier sections.

**Origin:** Problem B Phase 2 #1 (2025-11-18-chunked-generation)

**Value:**
- Earlier sections can reference later concepts
- Ensures document-wide consistency
- Bidirectional context flow

**Reconsider When:**
- v0.2.0 proves chunked generation works but reveals consistency issues
- Users frequently edit earlier sections after seeing later ones
- Inconsistencies between sections are common (>20% of docs)
- Users request "make Introduction match Features" explicitly

**Complexity:** High (bidirectional flow, state management)
**Effort:** 3-5 days

**Implementation Notes:**
- Post-generation validation pass
- Update earlier sections based on later content
- Maintain consistency across document
- Complex state management

title: Template Marketplace / Community Sharing
description:
Enable community template sharing and discovery platform.

**Merged from 3 occurrences:**
- Template Library #10: Template Marketplace / Sharing
- Standalone Tool #4: Template Marketplace
- Test Case #56: Template Marketplace

**Value:**
- Community template sharing and discovery
- Reduce template creation effort by reusing proven templates
- Discover best practices through popular templates

**Reconsider When:**
- Multiple projects use similar templates
- Users ask "where can I find templates for X?"
- Users create 5+ templates and want to share
- Clear demand for "standard templates" emerges
- Reusability patterns are understood

**Complexity:** High (infrastructure needed)
**Effort:** 1-2 weeks
**Uncertainty:** Unclear if templates are reusable across projects, what marketplace would look like

**Next Steps:**
- Understand template reusability through usage first
- Collect 10+ templates from real usage
- Identify which templates are actually reusable

title: Misleading Success Message When Generated Content Contains Errors
description: Displays "✅ Accepted: README.md updated" even when generated content contains LLM error messages instead of actual documentation, creating false confidence. Deferred because section-by-section review in chunked mode provides alternative solution. See original issue file for full details.

title: CI/CD Integration and Auto-Update

Automatically regenerate docs in CI/CD pipeline and create PRs with updates.

title: Incremental Context Updates for Changed Files

Track which sources changed and gather context only for changed files, not entire project.

title: Update Existing Documentation (UC2)

title: Rich Preview UI

Web-based preview with side-by-side diff, syntax highlighting.

- Users struggle with terminal diff

**Effort:** 1-2 weeks

title: Meta-Templates & Template Generation

Templates for creating templates (recursive layer).

title: Stability Mode - Include Existing Content to Reduce Variation

Include current content in prompts to minimize unnecessary changes and maintain stability.

**Reconsider When:**
- Template improvements (v0.5.0) don't reduce variation enough

**Complexity:** Medium (section extraction, prompt engineering)

- Extract current section content

title: Parallel Section Generation

title: Single-shot mode not implemented - both modes use chunked generator
description: CLI advertises two generation modes but single-shot mode isn't implemented. Both modes fall back to ChunkedGenerator, making --mode option misleading and non-functional. Missing file: single_generator.py. See original issue file for implementation proposal and full details.

title: Automatic Change Detection (Problem A Version)

**Why Valuable:**
Eliminates "should I regenerate?" decision overhead. Proactive maintenance.

- Git hooks integration
- File change heuristics

**Reconsider When:**

**Complexity:** Medium (git hooks, heuristics)
**Origin:** Problem A convergence (2025-11-18-problem-a-template-system)

title: Git Integration for Change Detection and Automation

title: Selective Section Regeneration
description:
Regenerate only specific sections of a document instead of the entire document.

**Merged from 3 occurrences:**
- Template Library #3: Selective Section Regeneration
- Test Case #44: Partial/Selective Updates
- Transcript #85: Selective Section Regeneration (UC2 - Update Flow)

**Value:**
- Faster regeneration (avoid regenerating entire doc)
- More controlled updates (surgical precision)
- Less review overhead (only review changed sections)
- Lower API costs (fewer LLM calls)
- Better stability (unchanged sections stay stable)

**Reconsider When:**
- Full doc regeneration is slow (>2 minutes) or users frequently want to update just one section
- Full-doc regeneration takes >1 minute regularly
- Users frequently discard most changes (only 1-2 sections meaningful)
- Section-level granularity clearly valuable
- Full doc regeneration causes too much churn
- API costs from regenerating entire docs become high

**Complexity:** Medium
**Effort:** 2-3 days
**Dependencies:** Requires section-to-source mapping as foundation

**Implementation Notes:**
- Command: `doc-evergreen regen-doc README.md --section Features`
- Needs section targeting capability
- Requires context management for isolated sections
- Must maintain document-level consistency

**Complexity:** Low (context sizing logic)
**Effort:** 1-2 days

**Implementation Notes:**
- Define context modes (minimal/standard/comprehensive)
- Adaptive context selection
- Cost estimation
- Quality vs cost trade-offs

title: Automatic Change Detection for Documentation Updates
description:
Detect when source files have changed and determine if documentation needs updating.

**Merged from 3 occurrences:**
- Template Library #8: Smart Change Detection (Source Tracking)
- Test Case #37: Automatic Change Detection
- Problem A #58: Automatic Change Detection (Problem A Version)

**Value:**
- Eliminates "should I regenerate?" decision overhead
- Proactive doc maintenance
- Track which sources changed, auto-determine which sections need updating
- Trigger updates only when content changes, not just timestamps

**Reconsider When:**
- Manual regeneration used 10+ times successfully
- Users repeatedly ask "how do I know when to regenerate?"
- Checking "should I regenerate?" becomes tedious
- MVP used for 10+ docs
- Manually checking "should I regenerate?" becomes tedious
- Selective regeneration exists and users manually track which sections to update

**Complexity:** Medium (file watching, git integration, heuristics, source tracking)
**Effort:** 2-3 days
**Dependencies:** Requires selective regeneration (Feature #3) first for full value

**Implementation Notes:**
- File watching capability
- Git hooks integration
- Heuristics for relevance
- Section-to-source mapping for targeted updates

title: Template Variants & Specialization
description:
Multiple templates for different documentation types.

- Contributing guide templates
- Specialized templates for different needs

title: Background Processing
description:
Regenerate docs in background, notify when complete.

**What it does:**
- Don't block user workflow
- Handle long-running generations
- Batch processing efficiency
- Better UX for large docs

**Why Valuable:**
Async execution for long-running operations.

**Why Deferred:**
- Synchronous execution is simpler
- Generation speed unknown
- Adds complexity for uncertain benefit

**Reconsider When:**
- Generation regularly takes >1 minute
- User wants to continue working during generation
- Batch regeneration becomes common
- Async explicitly requested

**Effort:** 3-4 days
**Complexity:** Medium
**Origin:** Problem A convergence (2025-11-18-problem-a-template-system)
